title: Fundamentals of Robot Kinematics and Dynamics
description: Covers the theory and application of mathematical models to analyze the kinematics and dynamics of robot mechanisms or their components using vector algebra, differential equations, and computer simulations; also covers robot vehicle kinematics, robot arm kinematics, and robot dynamics with computational examples and problems. Some basic programming skills and familiarity with MATLAB are expected. (Formerly CMPE 10.)

pre_req_data.text: Prerequisite(s): ECE 9, and AM 20 or MATH 24.

class_notes: Enroll in lecture and associated discussion section
